result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy M Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of synthetic cannabinoid, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(em).
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: jail sentence on count 6

miscConds.notes: Joint & several with co-defendant Cody Meyer (14CF30)

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.
The defendant must take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence the defendant is currently serving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy M Harris

records.addlTxt: Revoked - sentenced to Co Jail/HOC

02:29 PM Defendant Amy M Harris in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Amy M Harris in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Lynch and Harris have revocation summary/packet, no errors or inaccuracies. Discussion on file in regards to previously vacated counts/convictions. State - makes argument prior to his recommendation - recommends 9 months on each count (counts #2, #8 and #10) - concurrent to each other, with 92 days credit (stipulated). Lynch - makes argument prior to his recommendation - recommends 5 months on each count - concurrent to each other - 92 days credit. Harris makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #2, #8 and #10 - 7 months in FC jail - concurrent to each other - huber and good time allowed - credit for 92 days - no objection to transferring to another County but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s), enter civil judgment for unpaid costs, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 18, 2019 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Amy M Harris in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Amy M Harris in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:10 AM. State - reopened due to Harris being unproperly convicted (plead to a felony which should have been misd.) State recites recommendation - Counts 8, 9, 10 all amended to 961.41(3g)(d). Plead to Count 2, 3, 6, 8 & 10 as amended, remaining counts DRI including 9 as amended. Count 3 - $300 fine plus costs and surcharges, count 6 - $100 fine plus costs, 180 days in FC jail. Counts 2, 8 & 10 - 2 years probation (ct 2 - costs, ct 8 - $100 fine plus costs, ct 10 - $100 fine plus costs. Conditions: AODA, no possession, consumption, entry into any bars, FT emp/schooling, 100 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed by treating doctor. Court 8, 9 & 10 all amended to 961.41(3g)(d) - court reads amended charges and penalties. Court DRI in counts 1, 4, 5, 7 & 9. Harris pleads NC to counts 2, 3, 6, 8 and 10. Court has PLQ and goes over it with Harris - finds she is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering her plea, waiving her constitutional rights and right to trial, finds factual basis, accepts pleas and adjudges guilty. State makes statement - feeling this was a re-sentencing and asks court to follow recommendation. Burns makes statement and asks for 266 days credit. Court questions jail credit, discussion regarding jail credit and court will allow Burns and State to figure credit and submit stipulation for credit. Burns asks court to not impose 180 days in FC jail or to give credit for 180 days as she has already served the 180 days. Court - re-sentencing with amending charges and court will give credit for 180 days and any more days that may be avaialbe will be up to the parties to figure out. Count 3 - Fine of $300 plus costs, 60 days to pay after release, Count 6 - $100 fine plus costs, 180 days in FC jail concurrent with current sentence with 180 days credit. Counts 2, 8 & 10 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of AODA, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, FT emp/school, 100 hours community service to be completed with in 1st year of probation, costs on each count, probation is consecutive to any sentence currently serving. Appeal rights given. Must submit DNA sample with costs. Court vacates warrant.
to Produce - AMH
Order to Produce
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial on August 31, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Court allows withdrawal of plea set for further proceedings. dlw

Defendant Amy M Harris appears via telephone, in custody, with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns appearing in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:32 AM. State here for motion to reopen and withdraw plea. Burns amended motion added a paragraph (top of page 4) regarding constitutional rights. Burns had filed motion to re-consider was denied by the court and she filed amended motion to withdraw plea. Burns did not perform due diligence - charges plead should not have been felonies. Court questions Burns if ineffectively assistance of counsel 974.06. State - responds. Court not sure if it falls under the 974.06. State - concerned with guilty plea that was entered and states case law. Burns makes arguement on manifist of justice. State does not dispute that she plead to felonies which should have been misdemeanor charges. Court - considered all statements and makes ruling - finds defendant did not enter her plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently and will allow her to withdraw her plea. Vacate JOC, re-instate bond and set for trial. Will not have to have SEHR hearing. Issues warrant, body or $1000. Burns asks for FPT. Court will schedule for JT but if resolved before JT date, call to get on the calendar to set for PLEA. Court authorizes state to file amended INFO. Burns questions if open warrant will prevent her from ongoing programing or benefits in the faculity she is currently in. Social worker is on phone and does not believe it will prevent her from programs. JA to schedule as anaylist is needed.
Amended to withdraw plea
Motion hearing on May 26, 2017 at 10:30 am. Defendant's NOH was sent to Counsel to get to her.
to Withdraw Plea

Attorney Mary Burns in  court, defendant Amy M Harris not in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:10 am. Tried calling correctional institute and could not get thru. Court questions motion to reopen. Burns makes statement as to why the motion was filed. State doesn't agree with Burns statement. Asking for motion to reopen and amend judgment of conviction. Court denies the motion to reopen and amend judgment of conviction for stated reasons. State supplements the record. Burns doesn't believe that defendant wants to withdraw her plea and makes statement as to being revoked on charges that were not felonies which plead too when represented by counsel. Court will allow supplemental to motion. Burns doesn't believe that she can prepare her own motion for ineffective counsel. Court advises to look into postjudgment issue. Court will give opportunity to file something, may need briefing etc.
to reopen and reconsider - filed by atty Burns
State Public Defender
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 29, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Called at 9:48 AM. Amy Harris appears in person and in custody with attorney Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. State - resolved - defendant would plead G to counts #2, #3, #6, #8 and #10 as alleged and remaining counts will be DRI, joint recommendation on count #6 of a straight jail time of 180 days with a fine of $100 plus costs and on counts #2, #3, #8 and #10 - a joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: $100 fine plus costs and surcharges on counts #2, #3, #8 and #10,  AODA and follow thru, restitution of $786.37 owed to victim plus $78.63 VW for a total restitition amount of $865.00 - joint and several with co-defendant Cody Myer (14CF30), maintain absolute sobriety, no entry into any bars or taverns, employment/school, 100 hours of community service, take all meds as prescribed by treating physician or medical provider. Burns and Harris agree. Harris pleads G to counts #2, #3, #6, #8 and #10 as alleged. Court dismisses and reads in counts #1, #4, #5, #7, and #9. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constititonal rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts pleas, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - has complied with victim notification requirements. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - credit for 83 days to be applied to count #6. Harris makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #6 - 180 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 83 days (stipulated), $100 fine plus costs and surcharges - paid thru probation on other counts; counts #2, #3, #8 and #10 - withhold sentence and place on probation, for 3 years, concurrent to jail time on count #6, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, maintain/obtain full time employment/school with verbage, restitution to victim totalling $865.00 - joint and several with co-defendant Cody Meyer (14CF30), $100 fine plus costs and surcharges - paid thru probation, 100 hours of community service total, take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed, provide DNA sample with surcharge assessed - paid thru probation, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on May 28, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Called at 10:06 AM. Amy Harris appears via video from FOSO and with counsel Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns puts off record conversations on the record regarding possibly change in counsel. Harris will continue with Ms. Burns as counsel. Court continues bond, will set for another FPT on 5/28/14 at 9:30 AM.

Called at 2:50 PM. Amy Harris appears in person and in custody with attorney Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns is waiving PH. Court goes thru waiver of PH form, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, binds over for trial, finds probable cause. Burns has Information that mirrors complaint, waives reading of it, waives NG pleas to all counts, set for FPT on 5/14/14 at 10:00 AM. Court continues bond.
